title: Executive Order 6420-Authorization to Appoint Mrs. Mary M. Flanagan
content: By virtue of the authority vested in me by the provisions of the last sentence of the eighth paragraph of subdivision second of section 2 of the Civil Service Act of January 16, 1883 (ch. 27, 22 Stat. 403, 404), it is hereby ordered that Mrs. Mary M. Flanagan may be appointed to the position of charwoman in the custodial service of the Post Office Department at the Post Office Building in Boston, Mass., without compliance with the requirements of the civil service rules.
This order is recommended by the Postmaster General.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 6420-Authorization to Appoint Mrs. Mary M. Flanagan Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/362244
